articles.title: Asia breathes sigh of relief as US jobs fail to shock By Reuters - Investing.com

articles.author: Lin Weiwen
articles.title: How an ex-Singapore resident went from banker to winemaker - CNA
articles.description: Searching for a different pace of life, Cambridge-educated Tai-Ran Niew left a lucrative career in investment banking in Asia to pursue winemaking in America. Today, he grows Chardonnay and embraces a minimalistic way of farming.

articles.title: Growth in New Zealand's art sector a silver lining of the pandemic - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: OPINION: As countries across Asia actively invest in the arts, New Zealand has the opportunity to benefit from being part of the fastest-growing art market in the world.
articles.content: OPINION: The past 18 months have brought the value of the arts into sharp relief. With international travel restricted, we have relied on books, screens, music, the theatre and galleries to transport… [+5700 chars]
